main event: Radar detected 25 unidentified targets off the coast of Louisiana, accompanied by white flashes of light, on December 6, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be 25-30 miles from the aircraft, observed visually and tracked by radar,The sighting created significant interest among Coast Guard and USAF personnel,The event was recorded in Project Blue Book as an unidentified aerial phenomenon,The crew reported speeds exceeding 9,000 mph, and multiple objects were spotted moving rapidly along the radar,The radar operators noted that objects would appear and disappear suddenly, leading to confusion about their nature.
sighted object: Unidentified aerial targets with white flashes of light
witness description: Crew members from a Coast Guard cutter and USAF officers
